hook.text: European colonizers refused to believe Africans built Great Zimbabwe. They were wrongâ€”and racist.

buildup.text: Great Zimbabwe's stone walls, built without mortar, housed a kingdom of 18,000 people at its peak around 1300 AD.

discovery.text: The Shona people built it as a center of trade, connecting African gold to Indian Ocean merchants.

twist.text: Colonial archaeologists attributed it to Phoenicians or King Solomonâ€”anyone but local Africans. Politics shaped science.

climax.text: Modern archaeology has proven beyond doubt that Great Zimbabwe was built by indigenous Shona ancestors.

punchline.text: The truth about Great Zimbabwe was hidden by prejudice, not time.

quiz.question: Why did colonial archaeologists falsely attribute Great Zimbabwe to non-Africans?
options: They found inscriptions in foreign languages
Racial prejudice made them refuse to believe Africans built it
The architectural style closely resembled Middle Eastern designs
